summary: Nebius Group N.V.(NASDAQ:NBIS) dropped its share prices by 9.07 percent on Tuesday to close at $50.31 apiece . The company reached an all-time high of $55.75 on Monday before paring gains to end the day slightly lower .  The solution brings together the power and flexibility of Nebius's AI cloud with Saturn Cloud’s MLOps platform . It enables anyone to sign up instantly to use Jupyter notebooks or other IDEs, run jobs and deployments, and manage cloud resources on NVIDIA Hopper GPUs .

AI chip designer NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) is one of the stocks Jim Cramer recently discussed . Cramer continues to have faith in the company and believes CEO Jensen Huang’s belief that his company will play a key role in the rollout of humanoid robots . NVIDIA Corporation's shares did well in June as they closed the month 16.9% higher .  Cramer discussed NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) and the negotiations between the US and China: While we acknowledge the potential of NVDA as an investment, our conviction lies in the belief that some AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns and have limited downside risk .

Jen-Hsun Huang sold $35.2 million worth of shares in late June and early July . Huang still directly owns 75,248,225 shares in the company . Nvidia recently reached a $3.74 trillion valuation, remains near its 52-week high .  Nvidia chips are also powering spacecraft enhancements by Northrop Grumman . Cantor Fitzgerald reiterated an Overweight rating on Nvidia with a $200 price target . Investors will be watching whether further insider sales or new AI developments impact the stock's momentum .

Intel shares slid about 3% following news CEO may halt marketing of 18A technology to external clients . Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) surged about 3%, Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) rose around 2%, Broadcom (AVGO) edged up nearly 2%, and Qualcomm (QCOM) inched higher by about 1%.  The expanded credits build on the Biden administration's CHIPS and Science Act incentives . House lawmakers aim to send the bill to President Trump by July 4 deadline . Investors will watch whether the enhanced subsidies spur fresh U.S. chip plant announcements .
